Key Match Events: Noor Ahmad c Sharma b Arshdeep Singh 12 (18b 1x4 1x6 19m) SR: 66.66
Pre-Game Insights: Afghanistan's bowlers will ask questions, and India's batters must answer them
Rashid Khan and Fazalhaq Farooqi could be Afghanistan's trump cards
India could counter them with Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube
India vs Rashid Khan is a key matchup
Afghanistan possess a bowling attack capable of asking questions every over
Fazalhaq Farooqi's left-arm angle and ability to swing the new ball are threats to batters of even the highest quality
If India comes under scoreboard pressure, Rashid Khan could capitalize
Suryakumar Yadav has dominated Rashid in T20s, scoring 86 runs in 58 balls at a strike rate of 148 without being dismissed
Shivam Dube goes at a higher strike rate (155) over a smaller sample size (18 balls)
Rashid has not done as well against left-hand batters in T20s lately
Afghanistan's bowling is their best strength, but India have them covered
One of Afghanistan's batters will have to have a field day
Rahmanullah Gurbaz hits pace at a strike rate of 150 and spin at 145 in T20 cricket
Axar Patel's left-arm spin is all about containment, but he does that by attacking the stumps
Axar Patel's batting at No. 8 gives India the confidence to hit out from ball one
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bridgetown has offered decent batting conditions, having hosted one of the three 200-plus scores seen in this tournament
The weather shouldn't be a problem
Afghanistan have played India in 13 games across formats, but are yet to win one
Gurbaz (167) and Farooqi (12) are currently the highest scorer and the highest wicket-taker, respectively, in the T20 World Cup 2024
India have not faced Rashid a lot in T20Is, but in two games, they have scored 69 runs in eight overs without losing a single wicket to him
Rohit and Kohli are tied on 4042 T20I runs, with only Babar Azam (4145) ahead of them
Others: India don't have any need to tinker with their XI
Despite the loss to West Indies, Afghanistan might not change their XI

Probable Afghanistan XI: Rahmanullah Gurbaz (wk), Ibrahim Zadran, Gulbadin Naib, Azmatullah Omarzai, Mohammad Nabi, Najibullah Zadran, Karim Janat, Rashid Khan (capt), Noor Ahmad, Naveen-ul-Haq, Fazalhaq Farooqi
Probable India XI: Rohit Sharma (capt), Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant (wk), Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj, Arshdeep Singh
